data.name: Injection
data.description: Hey warriors, now is your opportunity to save the ancient city of Troy and change history! --- Sometimes in order to accomplish a task we have to shell out to the system. Write a function that returns the output of the `which` linux command for the given filename as argument. The argument either exists as a file or not. You shouldn't have to manipulate the stdout returned by the command. --- Example: * argument: `mkdir` * return: `/bin/mkdir` --- Code injections are one of the most common vulnerabilities in IT systems. Security is hard, weak code will be punished, trolled and given to the dogs! Enough said. WARRIOR, ARE YOU READY TO DEFEND TROY !?!
